p: Flow cytometry analysis (Fig. 4b) revealed a significantly more dendritic cells, neutrophils, and inflammatory monocytes in the lungs of L. paracasei-fed mice sacrificed at day 9 (48Â h after N. meningitidis infection) than those of the control group (PBS-fed mice). Although, there were more interstitial macrophages, patrolling monocytes, and eosinophils in the lungs of L. paracasei-fed mice sacrificed at day 9 than in control mice, the difference did not reach significance.
